returns._0: string The metadata URI of the collection

params.royaltyPercentageBps: The royalty percentage expressed in basis points
params.royaltyRecipient: Address to which royalties should be sent

returns._0: The royalty percentage expressed in the basis points
Address of the recipient of royalties

params.contributor: Address of the contributor whose status we are checking

returns._0: Boolean value indicating whether the address is a contributor or not

manageContributor(address,bool).details: Can only be called by the owner.Emits ***ContributorUpdate*** event.

params.grantRole: A boolean value signifying whether the contributor role is being granted (`true`) or revoked  (`false`)

returns._0: The maximum supply of tokens in the collection

renounceOwnership().details: Can only be called by the current owner.Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is  only available to the owner.

params.tokenId: ID of the token for which the royalty info is being retrieved

returns.receiver: The beneficiary receiving royalties of the sale
returns.royaltyAmount: The value of the royalties recieved by the `receiver` from the sale

returns._0: The number of tokens in a collection

transferOwnership(address).details: Can only be called by the current owner.

params.newOwner: Address of the new owner's account

updateRoyaltyRecipient(address).details: Custom access control has to be implemented to ensure that only the intended actors can update the  beneficiary.

params.newRoyaltyRecipient: Address of the new recipient of royalties

collectionMetadata().notice: Used to retrieve the metadata of the collection.

constructor.notice: Initializes the smart contract with a given maximum supply and minting price.

getRoyaltyPercentage().notice: Used to retrieve the specified royalty percentage.

getRoyaltyRecipient().notice: Used to retrieve the recipient of royalties.

isContributor(address).notice: Used to check if the address is one of the contributors.

manageContributor(address,bool).notice: Adds or removes a contributor to the smart contract.

maxSupply().notice: Used to retrieve the maximum supply of the collection.

name().notice: Used to retrieve the collection name.

owner().notice: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().notice: Leaves the contract without owner. Functions using the `onlyOwner` modifier will be disabled.

royaltyInfo(uint256,uint256).notice: Used to retrieve the information about who shall receive royalties of a sale of the specified token and  how much they will be.

symbol().notice: Used to retrieve the collection symbol.

totalAssets().notice: Used to retrieve the total number of assets.

totalSupply().notice: Used to retrieve the total supply of the tokens in a collection.

transferOwnership(address).notice: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new owner.

updateRoyaltyRecipient(address).notice: Used to update recipient of royalties.

documentation.text:
@notice Used to retrieve the total supply of the tokens in a collection.
 @return The number of tokens in a collection

@notice Used to retrieve the maximum supply of the collection.
 @return The maximum supply of tokens in the collection

@notice Used to retrieve the total number of assets.
 @return The total number of assets

@notice Used to retrieve the metadata of the collection.
 @return string The metadata URI of the collection

@notice Used to retrieve the collection name.
 @return Name of the collection

@notice Used to retrieve the collection symbol.
 @return Symbol of the collection
